dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3825 IH: To prohibit the use of Department of Defense funds for adult cabaret performances.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rosendale (for himself, Mrs. Harshbarger, Mrs. Luna, Mr. Zinke, Mr. Brecheen, Ms. Hageman, and Mr. Posey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To prohibit the use of Department of Defense funds for adult cabaret performances.

section.header: Prohibition on use of funds for adult cabaret performances

subsection.text: None of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available for the Department of Defense and no facilities owned or operated by Department of Defense may be used to host, advertise, or otherwise support an adult cabaret performance.

In this section, the term adult cabaret performance means a performance that features topless dancers, go-go dancers, exotic dances, strippers, or male or female impersonators who provide entertainment that appeals to prurient interest.
